page.title: 05SUNDAY AT PETTICOAT LANE
page.content: {*}As Bradwell is such a small village there are not many opportunities to earn money during my spare time.I am lucky as I have a part-time job in London selling fur coats on Petticoat Lane Market.It is my uncle's stall.We drive to his house on Saturday night to get an early start on Sunday morning.He lives in Tilbury which is about one-and-a-half hours from Liverpool Street.We leave at six in the morning and set up the stall ready for business by eight. {*}We sell mostly coney(rabbit) coats in every colour imaginable.We also sell fox,afghan,goat and dog.If we are asked we could supply mink,but they are too valuable to bring with us every week.
